tuv.seg: The State Pension (Contributory) is paid to people from the age of 66 who have enough Irish social insurance contributions
Tá an Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) iníoctha le daoine in Éirinn a bhfuil a ndóthain Ranníocaíochtaí Leasa Shóisialaigh íoctha acu agus a bhfuil 66 bliain slán acu
It is not means-tested
Níl aon tástáil acmhainne i gceist
You can have other income and still get a State Pension (Contributory)
Féadfaidh tú Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) a fháil agus ioncam agat ó fhoinsí eile
This pension is taxable but you are unlikely to pay tax if it is your only income
Tá an pinsean seo inchánach ach má tá tú gan aon ioncam eile, ní miste cáin a ghearradh air
As the social insurance conditions are very complex you should apply for a State Pension (Contributory) if you have ever worked and have any contributions (stamps) paid at any time
Tá na coinníollacha a bhaineann le hárachas sóisialta an-chasta agus ba chóir duit cur isteach ar Phinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) má tá obair agus ranníocaíocht (stampa) déanta agat uair ar bith

There are a number of pro-rata pensions available to people who paid different types of social insurance contributions or who did not pay contributions because of various reasons (see below). Changes are proposed to the current system in 2020 (see 'Further information' below)

Tá roinnt Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) éagsúla pro-rata ar fáil do dhaoine atá íocaíochtaí éagsúla árachais sóisialta á déanamh acu nó atá gan aon ranníocaíocht á déanamh acu ar chúiseanna éagsúla - féach thíos
If you retire early, you should ensure that you continue to pay PRSI contributions or get credited contributions (if eligible) to maintain your entitlement to a pension

Má théann tú ar scor go luath ba chóir duit a dhéanamh cinnte go leanann tú ar aghaidh ag déanamh na ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC nó ranníocaíochtaí creidiúnaithe a fháil chun do theidlíocht ar phinsean a choimeád
If you are getting Jobseeker's Benefit (JB) and are aged between 65 and 66 when your JB would normally end, you may continue to receive it until the age of 66, provided you meet the PRSI requirements

Má tá Sochar Cuardaitheora Poist (SCP) á fháil agat agus má chríochnaíonn do SCP de ghnáth nuair tá tú idir 65 agus 66 bliain d'aois, b'fhéidir go bhfaighfeá an íocaíocht go dtí aois 66 a fhad agus a chomhlíonann tú na riachtanais ÁSPC
The Department of Social Protection has published FAQs on Qualifying for the State Pension (Contributory) which can help you to work out whether you qualify for a State Pension (Contributory)

D'fhoilsigh an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí, FAQs cabhróidh sé leat oibriú amach an bhfuil tú i dteideal Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach). D’athraigh an t Acht um Athchóiriú an Dlí Leasa Shóisialaigh agus um Pinsin 2006 (pdf) ainm an Phinsean Ranníocach Seanaoise go Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach). Tháinig an t-ainm nua i bhfeidhm an 29 Meán Fómhair, 2006
To qualify for a State Pension (Contributory) you must be aged 66 or over and have enough Class A, E, F,G, H, N or S social insurance contributions
Ní mór duit a bheith 66 bliana d'aois agus dóthain ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta Rannóige A, E, F, G, H, N nó S a bheith déanta agat le bheith i dteideal an pinsean seo a fháil
Have paid social insurance contributions before a certain age
Ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta a bheith déanta agat roimh aois áirithe
Have a certain number of social insurance contributions paid and
Oiread áirithe ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta a bheith déanta agat agus
Have a certain average number over the years since you first started to pay
Líon áirithe díobh a bheith déanta agat ar an mheán i rith na mblianta ó thosaigh tú ag íoc don chéad uair
Paid insurance before a certain age
An t-árachas a bheith íoctha roimh aois áirithe
You must have started to pay social insurance before the age of 56
Caithfidh tú a bheith tagtha isteach sa scéim árachais roimh aois áirithe
(The age limit is higher for people born before 1922.)
I gcás daoine atá faoi bhun 66 faoi láthair, caithfidh sé gur thosaigh siad ag íoc as árachas sóisialta roimh aois a 56
Your entry into insurance means the date on which you first started to pay social insurance
Séard atá i gceist le tosú sa scéim árachais ná an dáta ar thosaigh tú ag íoc as árachas sóisialta don chéad uair
The rules that determine when you entered into insurance are quite complex for those with mixed insurance, that is, full social insurance for some of the time and modified at other times

Tá castacht ag baint leis na rialacha a dhearbhaíonn cathain ar tháinig tú isteach sa scéim árachais má tá árachas measctha ag an té sin. Is é sin le rá go raibh lán-árachas sóisialta aige nó aici cuid den am agus árachas athraithe uaireanta eile
Normally the date of starting insurable employment is taken as the date of the first paid employment contribution
De ghnáth glactar leis gur é an dáta tosú fostaíochta inárachais, dáta an chéad ranníocaíocht fostaíochta íoctha

However if you have a mixture of full- and modified-rate contributions and paid your first full-rate employment contribution before 6 April 1991 and before you reached 56 years of age, your entry into insurance can be the date on which you first started to pay the full rate of insurance if that would be to your advantage

Má thosaigh tú ag íoc lán-árachais roimh 6 Aibreán 1991 agus roimh a mbíonn tú 56 bliain d'aois, glacfar leis gur tháinig tú isteach sa scéim árachais ar an dáta ar thosaigh tú ag íoc an ráta iomlán árachais - más tairbheach duit an socrú seo
If you started to pay full insurance after 6 April 1991, your entry into insurance is the time you first paid any social insurance
Má thosaigh tú ag íoc as lán-árachas i ndiaidh an 1 Aibreán 1991, glactar leis gur tháinig tú isteach sa scéim árachais an t-am a thosaigh tú ag íoc árachais shóisialta de chineál ar bith
There are also special entry into insurance rules for self-employed people
Tá rialacha faoi leith ann maidir le teacht isteach sa scéim árachais i gcás daoine féinfhostaithe

PRSI for the self-employed was first introduced on 6 April 1988. If you started to pay self-employed contributions on 6 April 1988 and had previously paid employee insurance at any time, then the date of entry into insurance can be either 6 April 1988 or the date on which you actually first paid insurance, whichever is to your advantage

Má thosaigh tú ag déanamh ranníocaíochtaí féinfhostaithe ar an 6 Aibreán 1988 agus má bhí ranníocaíochtaí íoctha agat mar fhostaí uair ar bith roimhe sin, is féidir leat do rogha a dhéanamh idir an 6 Aibreán 1988 agus an chéad lá riamh ar íoc tú as árachas agus dáta is fearr a oireann duit a bheith agat
Number of paid contributions
Líon na ranníocaíochtaí a rinneadh
If you reach pension age on or after April 6 2012, you need to have 520 full-rate contributions (10 years contributions)
Má shroicheann tú aois an phinsin ar nó i ndiaidh 6 Aibreán 2012, ní mór duit 520 ranníocaíocht a bheith déanta agat (ranníocaíochtaí 10 mbliana)
In this case, only 260 of the 520 contributions may be voluntary contributions
Sa chás seo, ní féidir go mbeadh níos mó ná 260 den 520 ina ranníocaíochtaí deonacha

However, if you were a voluntary contributor on or before April 6 1997 and you have a yearly average of 20 contributions, you may meet the requirement if you have a total of 520 full-rate contributions (of which only 156 need to be compulsory paid contributions)

Más rud é, áfach, go raibh tú i do ranníocthóir deonach ar an 6 Aibreán 1997, nó roimhe, agus má tá 20 ranníocaíocht déanta ar an mheán agat in aghaidh na bliana, féadfaidh tú an riachtanas a shásamh má tá 520 ranníocaíocht déanta agat san iomlán, agus a chás sin, ní gá ach go mbeadh 156 díobh ina ranníocaíochtaí a rinneadh go héigeantach
If you reached pension age on or after 6 April 2002, you needed to have 260 full-rate contributions (effectively 5 years contributions but they do not need to be consecutive)
Má shroicheann tú aois an phinsin ar nó i ndiaidh 6 Aibreán 2002, nár mhór duit 260 ranníocaíocht a bheith déanta agat (ranníocaíochtaí 5 bliana ach ní gá dóibh bheith comhleanúnacha)
If you reached pension age before 6 April 2002, you needed 156 qualifying full-rate contributions (a total of 3 years but they did not have to be consecutive)
Má shroicheann tú aois an phinsin roimh 6 Aibreán 2002, nár mhór duit 156 ranníocaíocht a bheith déanta agat (ranníocaíochtaí 3 bliana ach ní gá dóibh bheith comhleanúnacha)
Note that social insurance contributions fall into the four groups below
Bíonn ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh roinnte ina gceithre ghrúpa thíos
• Full-rate social insurance contributions are PRSI contributions at Classes A, E, F, G, H, N and S or at the 'ordinary' rate before 6 April 1979
• Is ionann ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh ar lánráta agus ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC in Aicmí A, E, F, G, H agus N nó ar 'ghnáthráta' roimh 6 Aibreán 1979
• Modified-rate social insurance contributions are PRSI contributions at Classes B, C and D (paid by civil and public servants)
• Is ionann ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh ar ráta mionathraithe agus ranníocaíochtaí ÁSPC in Aicmí B, C agus D (íoctha ag fostaithe sa tseirbhís phoiblí agus státseirbhísigh)
• Voluntary contributions are made by people under age 66 who are no longer covered by compulsory PRSI provided they satisfy certain conditions
• Bíonn ranníocaíochtaí deonacha déanta ag daoine faoi bhun 66 bliain d'aois nach bhfuil cuimsithe faoi ÁSPC éigeantach a thuilleadh, fad is go sásaíonn siad coinníollacha áirithe
• Credited contributions ('credits') are similar to the social insurance contributions you pay while employed and are usually awarded at the same rate as your last paid social insurance contribution

• Tá ranníocaíochtaí creidiúnaithe ('creidmheasanna') cosúil leis na ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh a íocann tú nuair atá tú fostaithe agus is gnách go mbíonn siad bronnta ar an ráta céanna le do ranníocaíocht dheireanach íoctha árachais shóisialaigh
You may get credits when you are claiming a social welfare payment
Is féidir leat creidmheasanna a fháil fad is atá íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh á héileamh agat
Credits are not allowed after self-employed contributions (Class S)
Ní cheadaítear creidmheasanna tar éis ranníocaíochtaí féinfhostaithe (Aicme S)
Average number of contributions per year
Meán ranníocaíochtaí in aghaidh na bliana
You must meet the average condition
Ní mór duit an mheánchoinníoll a shásamh
This is probably the most complex aspect of qualifying for a State Pension (Contributory)
Is dócha gurb é seo an ghné is casta a bhaineann le cáiliú le pinsean a fháil agus an ceann is mó a chothaíonn fadhbanna agus aimhrialtachtaí

The normal average rule states that you must have a yearly average of at least 10 appropriate contributions paid or credited from the year you first entered insurance or from 1953, whichever is later to the end of the tax year before you reach pension age (66)

De réir riail an ghnáthmheáin ní mór duit deich ranníocaíocht chuí ar a laghad a bheith déanta agat nó creidiúnaithe duit mar mheánráta bliantúil ón bhliain a ndeachaigh tú isteach sa scéim árachais, nó ó 1953 i leith (cibé acu is déanaí) suas go dtí deireadh an bhliain chánach sula sroicheann tú aois an phinsin (66). Má bhíonn 10 gcinn mar mheán-ráta bliantúil agat tá tú i dteideal an bunphinsean a fháil
An average of 10 entitles you to a minimum pension; you need an average of 48 to get the maximum pension
Ní mór duit 48 gcinn a bheith agat mar mheán-ráta chun an phinsean iomlán a fháil
This alternative average only applies to people who reach pension age on or after 6 April 1992
Ní bhaineann an meán malartach seo ach leo siúd a shroicheann aois an phinsin ar an 6 Aibreán 1992 nó ina dhiaidh

It requires that you have an average of 48 Class A, E, F, G, H, N or S contributions (paid or credited) for each contribution year from the 1979/80 tax year to the end of the tax year before you reach pension age (66)

Dar réir na rialach seo ní mór duit 48 ranníocaíocht Rannóige A, E, F, G, H, N nó S a bheith déanta agat, nó creidiúnaithe duit, ar an meán in aghaidh gach bliain íocaíochta ó an bliain ranníoca 1979/80 suas go dtí an bhliain ranníoca dheiridh iomlán agus an bhliain sin san áireamh go dtí do 66ú breithlá
This average would entitle you to the maximum pension
Dá mbeadh an mheánuimhir seo agat bheifeá i dteideal pinsean iomlán a fháil
There is no provision for a reduced pension when this alternative average is used
Níl aon fhoráil ann pinsean níos lú a chur ar fáil nuair a úsáidtear an meán malartach seo
So, if you reach the age of 66 on or after April 6 1992, your average will be looked at in two ways - the usual average will be assessed and the alternative average will be assessed
Mar sin, má bhíonn an 66 bliana slán agat ar an 6 Aibreán 1992, déanfar do mheánuimhir ranníocaíochtaí a mheas ar dhá bhealach - faoin ngnáthmheán agus faoin meán malartach
Most employed or formerly employed people will be able to meet the alternative average
Beidh formhór d'fhostaithe agus d'iarfhostaithe na tíre in ann an meán malartach a shásamh
The alternative average will probably be looked at first because it is easier to assess
Is dócha go ndéanfar an meán malartach a scrúdú ar dtús toisc gur fusa é a mheas

If you do not have an average of 48 contributions from 1979 then the normal method of assessing the average will be looked at and you may get a reduced pension (if you do not meet the alternative average, it is virtually impossible for you to have an average of 48 using the normal average rule)

Mura bhfuil 48 ranníocaíocht déanta agat ar an mheán ó 1979 i leith déanfar an mheánuimhir a mheas ar an ngnáthbhealach agus b'fhéidir go bhfaighidh tú pinsean laghdaithe. (Mura n-éiríonn leat an meán malartach a shásamh beidh sé beagnach dodhéanta 48 acu a bheith agat mar mheán ar an ngnáthbhealach)
Working in the home and State pensions
Ag obair sa bhaile agus pinsin Stáit
The Homemakers' Scheme makes it easier for people who stop working for a period to take care of children or adults to qualify for pensions
I 1994, rinneadh rialacháin a bheadh sé a dhéanamh níos éasca cáiliú le haghaidh pinsean, do dhaoine a ghlacann saoire chun cúram do bhaill teaghlaigh a thabhairt
The scheme was introduced from 6 April 1994 and applies to anyone who provides full-time care for a child under age 12 or an ill or disabled person age 12 or over
Baineann an Scéim um Chúramaí Baile le daoine a bhí ina gcúramóirí ó 1994 i leith
It does not apply to time spent caring before the introduction of the scheme
Ní bhaineann sé leo siúd a bhí ina gcúramóirí roimh 1994 agus ní rachaidh sé chun tairbhe morán dóibh siúd a d'éirigh as a gcuid oibre go buan
It is most beneficial for people who work outside the home for a number of years and then spend a number of years as carers
Baineann sé go háirithe leo siúd a bhí ag obair taobh amuigh den bhaile ar feadh roinnt blianta, a chaith roinnt blianta mar chúramóir agus d'fhill arís ar an obair taobh amuigh
It applies equally to women and men
Baineann sé le fir agus le mná

From 6 April 1994, a contribution year spent as a homemaker may be disregarded in the calculation of the yearly average (see above) up to a maximum of 20 years. This has the effect of increasing your yearly average as the same number of total contributions are divided by a smaller number of years

Ón 5ú Aibreán 1994 i leith is féidir neamh-aird a dhéanamh ar aon bhliain síntiúis (ach teorann 20 bliain leis) a chaith duine mar chúramóir baile, nuair atá comháireamh á dhéanamh ar an meán bliantúil
So, the fact that you do not have any contributions in those years will not reduce your yearly average and will make it easier for you to qualify for a State Pension (Contributory)
Mar sin, cé nach bhfuil aon síntiúis íoctha agat ar na blianta sin, ní chuirfidh sé seo isteach ar do chuid cearta pinsin
There are a number of pro-rata pensions, which were introduced because of the exclusion of some people from the social insurance system at particular times

Tá roinnt pinsean pro-rata ann a tugadh isteach toisc na bhfadhbanna agus na haimhrialtachatí a d'eascair ó fheidhmiú riail na meánuimhreacha ranníocaíochtaí agus toisc go raibh daoine áirithe eisiata ón gcóras árachais shóisialta ag uaireanta éagsúla
Pro-rata pension for mixed insurance
Pinsean pro-rata le haghaidh árachas meascaithe
Pro-rata pensions were introduced for people with mixed insurance records
Is iad ar déanadh socrú faoi phinsean dá-réir dóibh, ná iad siúd a raibh árachas measctha acu

Mixed insurance arises when a person spends part of his/her working life in the public service paying modified social insurance contributions and part in the private sector paying full rate social insurance contributions

Thárlodh go mbeadh árachas measctha ag duine nuair a chaitheann sé/sí cuid dá s(h)aol ag obair sa tseirbhís póiblí agus ag íoc ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh mionathraithe agus cuid eile dá s(h)aol sa rannóg phríobháideach ag íoc ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh ag an ráta iomlán
Many people have had a career in both the public and private sector but do not have mixed insurance
Tá daoine ann a bhí fostaithe sa rannóg phoiblí agus sa rannóg phríobháideach nach bhfuil árachas measctha acu
This is because no insurance was payable by people whose incomes were above certain limits before 1 April 1974
Tharla sé seo de bhárr nach raibh gá do dhaoine a raibh a n-ioncam os cionn teorainn áirithe, aon árachas a íoc roimh ó 1 Aibreán 1974

Certain groups who are now insured were outside the scope of the system - Gardai are insurable since 1 April 1974; certain members of religious orders since 6 April 1988 and doctors and dentists in the civil service since 6 April 1988

Bhí grúpaí áirithe atá anois ag íoc árachais, taobh amuigh den chóras-thosaigh Gárdaí ag íoc árachais ó Aibreán 1974; thosaigh baill áirithe de na hoird rialta á íoc ó Aibreán 1988 agus dochtúirí agus fiaclóirí sa stát sheirbhís ó Aibreán 1988
People with mixed insurance may have enough full rate contributions to enable them to qualify for a State Pension (Contributory)
D'fhéadfadh go mbeadh a ndóthain ranníocaíochtaí ag an ráta iomlán ag daoine chun go mbéidís i dteideal Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach)
This depends on the exact circumstances of each case
Braitheann sé seo ar chuinsí gach cás ann féin
It could happen that one person would qualify while another, who might have more contributions, would not qualify
D'fhéadfadh go mbeadh duine amháin i dteideal an phinsin agus nach mbeadh duine eile, in ainneoin níos mó ranníocaíochtaí a bheith ag an dara duine
Since 1991, a State Pension (Contributory) may be payable on a pro-rata basis to people with mixed insurance
Ó 1991 i leith is féidir Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) a íoc ar bhonn pro rata le daoine a bhfuil árachas measctha acu
If you reach pension age on or after 6 April 2012, you need to have a total of at least 520 full-rate and modified rate contributions paid
Má shroicheann tú aois a 66 ar nó tar éis 6 Aibreán 2012 caithfidh 520 ranníocaíocht idir an ráta iomlán agus an ráta mionathraithe a bheith agat
• At least 260 paid contributions at the full rate since entry into insurance or 1953, whichever is later
• Ar a laghadh 260 ranníocaíochtaí a bheith íoctha nó curtha chun sochair duit ó chuaigh tú isteach in árachas nó ó 1953 pé acu is déanaí

• A mixture of full and modified contributions, which when added together give you a yearly average of 10 (for the State Pension Contributory) from the time you first entered insurance or 1953, whichever is later, to the end of the contribution year before your 66th birthday

• Meascán de lán ranníocaíochtaí agus de ranníocaíochtaí laghdaithe a bheith agat a thugann, nuair a shuimítear iad meán bliantúil 10 ón am a ndeachaigh tú isteach in árachas ar dtús, nó ó 1953 pé acu is déanaí, go dtí deireadh na bliana ranníocaíochtaí roimh do 66ú breithlá
• Failed to qualify for a pension under EU regulations or under reciprocal arrangements with other countries or only qualified for a pension at a lower rate than this pro-rata pension would give you

• Gur theip ort pinsean a fháil faoi rialacha an AE nó faoi shocrú cómhalartach le tíortha eile, nó go raibh tú i dteideal pinsean a bhí ar ráta níos ísle ná an ceann a bheadh agat de bhárr an phinsin dá-réir
If you meet all these requirements, you may qualify for a pension proportionate to the number of contributions that you have at the full rate
Má chomhlíonann tú na riachtanais seo ar fad, d'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal pinsean a bheadh i gcomhréir leis an méid ranníocaíochtaí a bhí íoctha agat ag an ráta iomlán
To take a very simple example, if you worked for 40 years up to age 66 and 10 of those were in the private sector, you would get one-quarter of the normal pension

Tóg sampla an-simplí, má bhí tú ag obair ar feadh 40 bliain suas go dtí aois a 66 agus gur chaith tú deich mbliana acu sin sa rannóg phríobháideach is aon ceathrú den ghnáth phinsean a bheadh ag dul duit
The amount paid is in proportion to your full-rate contributions as a percentage of your overall contributions
Tá an méid íoctha i gcomhréir do ranníocaíochtaí ag an ráta iomlán mar chéatadán iomlán do ranníocaíochtaí
To calculate your pension you add contributions at the full and modified rates together
Chun do phinsean a ríomh, suimítear le chéile na ranníocaíochtaí a bhí íoctha ag an ráta iomlán agus ag an ráta mionathraithe
The average is then measured in the normal way
Déantar an meán a thomhais ar an ngnáth bhealach, ansin
If you have an average of at least 10 then you may qualify
Má tá 10 ranníocaíocht ar an meán agat d'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal an phinsin
Then the number of full rate contributions is divided by the total number of contributions to find out what proportion are full rate; you then get that proportion of the pension
Ansin roinntear an líon ranníocaíochtaí atá agat ag an ráta iomlán ar an líon iomlán ranníocaíochtaí chun a fháil amach cén codán acu atá ag an ráta iomlán
The Increase for a Qualified Adult payable with this pension is proportioned as well
Bíonn an Méadú do Dhuine Fásta Cáilithe, a théann leis an bpinsean seo, comhréireach freisin
Pro-rata pension for intermittent insurance
Pinsin pro-rata d'árachas uaineach
This pension applied to people with intermittent insurance and who had a yearly average of under 10
Baineann an pinsean seo le daoine atá árachas uaineach acu le meánuimhir bliantúil 10 nó níos lú
It no longer applies to new applicants (from January 2013)
Ní bhaineann sé le hiarratasóirí nua a thuilleadh (ó Eanáir 2013)
This pro-rata pension was only payable to people who meet specific conditions
Níor íocadh an pinsean pro-rata seo ach amháin le daoine a chomhlíonann na coinníollacha speisialta
That is, they had to have a broken insurance record and have re-entered insurance in 1974 because of the removal of the income limit
Caithfidh siad taifead briste a bheith acu agus a tháinig isteach in árachas arís sa bhliain 1974 nuair a cuireadh deireadh leis an teorainn ioncaim
Their average is measured in the usual way and if that average is 10 or more they got a pension in the normal way
Déantar an mheánuimhir a mheas ar an ngnáthbhealach agus má tá 10 nó breis acu ar an meán faigheann siad pinsean ar an ngnáthbhealach
However, if it was between 5 and 9 they got a special partial pension which was one quarter of the maximum pension
Áfach, má tá sí idir 5 agus 9, fuair siad pinsean pro-rata, (ceathrú den uasphinsean)
See Further information below for more information on other pro-rata pensions that no longer apply to many people (because most people who would qualify are now over 66)
Féach ‘Tuilleadh eolais’ chun faisnéis bhreise maidir le pinsin pro-rata eile nach baineann le go leor daoine (tá an chuid is mó den daoine incháilithe os cionn aois 66)

If you have worked in Ireland and one or more EU states your social insurance contributions from each EU state will be added to your Irish social insurance contributions to help you qualify for a social welfare payment

Má d'oibrigh tú in Éirinn agus i mballstát nó i mballstáit de chuid an AE, cuirfear do chuid ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta ó gach ballstát le do chuid ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta in Éirinn le gur fearr do theideal ar íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh
More information about combining your social insurance contributions to qualify for a state pension is available
Tá tuilleadh eolais ar fáil faoi do chuid ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialta a chur le chéile le teideal a fháil ar phinsean stáit
Increases for a qualified adult and pensioners over 80 years of age are calculated in the same way as the personal rate of pension
Oibrítear amach na liúntais le haghaidh daoine fásta agus le haghaidh daoine ós cionn 80 ar an mbealach seo freisin
Increases for a qualified child are payable from one country only and, if from Ireland, are paid in full
Ní féidir an liúntas le haghaidh páiste cleithiúnaigh a fháil ach ó thír amháin agus más as Éirinn atá sé ag teacht íocfar ina iomláine é
Bilateral social security agreements
Comhaontuithe déthaobhach leasa ahóisialaigh
Ireland has bilateral social security agreements with Canada, the USA, Australia, New Zealand, Austria, Japan, Republic of Korea and Quebec (which has a separate system from the rest of Canada)

Tá comhaontuithe déthaobhach leasa shóisialaigh ag Éirinn le Ceanada, na Stáit Aontaithe, An Astráil, An Nua Shéalainn, An Eilbhéis, an Ostair, an tSeapáin, Korea, agus le Quebec (a bhfuil córas éagsúil aici ón gcuid eile de Cheanada)
These agreements are broadly similar and they generally provide that social insurance paid in Ireland and the other country can be combined to help people qualify for old age and retirement pensions

Tríd is tríd tá na haontais seo cosúil le chéile agus go hiondúil socraíonn siad gur féidir árachas sóisialta a íoctar in Éirinn agus i dtíortha eile, a chur le chéile chun go mbeadh daoine i dteideal pinsin sean-aoise agus pinsin scoir
Again, in general, the method of calculation is similar to the EU rules
Go hiondúil bíonn an módh a úsáidtear chun méid an phinsin a oibriú amach, cosúil le rialacha an AE

Note that any increase for a qualified adult that you may qualify for will be paid directly to your spouse, civil partner or cohabitant unless they state that they wish to have it paid to you

You may qualify for Supplementary Welfare Allowance if there is a delay in processing your claim

This applies to State Pension (Contributory and Transition) and Widow's, Widower's or Surviving Civil Partner's (Contributory) Pension

Changes to the State Pension (Contributory)
Athruithe ar an bPinsean Stáit (Ranníocach)
The Social Welfare and Pensions Act 2011 made a number of changes to the qualifying age for State pensions
Rinne an tAcht Leasa Shóisialaigh agus Pinsean 2011 roinnt athruithe ar an aois cháilitheach do na pinsin Stáit
The qualifying age will rise to 67 in 2021 and 68 in 2028. So:
Beidh an aois cháilitheach ardaithe go dtí 67 bliain i 2021 agus 68 bliain i 2028 mar a leanas:
• If you were born on or after 1 January 1955 the minimum qualifying State pension age will be 67
• Má saolaíodh tú an 1 Eanáir 1955 nó ina dhiaidh ní cháileoidh tú don Pinsean Stáit go dtí go mbeidh tú 67 bliain ar a laghad
• If you were born on or after 1 January 1961 the minimum qualifying State pension age will be 68
• Má saolaíodh tú an 1 Eanáir 1961 nó ina dhiaidh ní cháileoidh tú don Pinsean Stáit go dtí go mbeidh tú 68 bliain ar a laghad
Under the National Pensions Framework a number of other changes were proposed to the qualifying conditions for the State Pension (Contributory). This is a summary of the proposals
Faoin gCreatlach Náisiúnta um Pinsin tá roinnt athruithe eile pleanáilte do na choinníollacha cáilitheacha don Phinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) (ó 2020)
Note that legislation is required before these changes come into effect and that, at present, these remain proposals
Teastaíonn reachtaíocht sula dtagann na hathruithe seo i bhfeidhm
The main change proposed was the introduction of a total contributions approach to replace the current yearly averaging system
Is é an príomhathrú atá molta ná tabhairt isteach cur chuige ranníocaíochtaí iomláin chun teacht in áit an chórais atá ann faoi láthair
This means that the amount of pension paid to you would be directly proportionate to the number of social insurance contributions and/or credits you have made over your working life

Ciallaíonn sé seo go mbeidh méid an phinsin a íocfar leat díreach ar aon dul le líon na ranníocaíochtaí árachais shóisialaigh agus/nó creidmheasanna a d'fhéadfadh a bheith íoctha agat thar do shaol oibre
So if you were born after 1 January 1954, when you reach pension age, you would need a total of 30 years contributions and/or credits to get the maximum State Pension
Más rud é gur rugadh thú tar éis 1 Eanáir 1954, nuair a bhaineann tú aois an phinsin amach, teastóidh 30 bliain de ranníocaíochtaí agus/nó creidmheasanna chun an Pinsean Stáit is mó a fháil
You would be able to get the minimum State Pension if you have paid 520 full-rate contributions (10 years)
Beidh tú in ann an Pinsean Stáit is lú a fháil má tá 520 ranníocaíocht ag an ráta iomláin íoctha agat (10 mbliana)
The minimum pension would be one third of the maximum rate
Beidh an pinsean is lú ag aon trian den ráta uasta
You could then get a further 1/30th of the pension for each additional year of contributions that you have
Is féidir leat aon tríocha eile den phinsean a fháil do gach bliain bhreise ar ranníocaíochtaí atá agat
The maximum number of credits that could be used in calculating your entitlement to State Pension would be 520 (or 10 years)
Is é an líon uasta de chreidmheasanna gur féidir leat a úsáid agus do theidlíocht Pinsin Stáit á ríomh ná 520 (nó 10 mbliana)
Pro-rata pension for self-employed people
Pinsean pro-rata do dhaoine féin-fhostaithe
The self-employed have been obliged to pay social insurance since 1988
Tá dualgas ar dhuine féin-fhostaithe árachas sóisialta a íoc ó 1988 i leith
Prior to that, some self-employed people were voluntarily paying insurance
Roimhe sin bhíodh roinnt daoine féin-fhostaithe ag íoc árachais go deonach
Some self-employed people were already over the minimum age when they first started to pay contributions in 1988
Bhí roinnt daoine féin-fhostaithe os cionn an íos-aois cheana féin nuair a thosaigh siad ag íoc árachais i 1988
In April 1999, a special pro-rata pension was introduced for them
Í mí Aibreáin 1999 tugadh isteach pinsean speisialta dá-réir, don dream seo
Only people aged 56 or over on 6 April 1988 (born on or before 6 April 1932) qualify for this pension
D'fhéadfá a bheith i dteideal an phinsin dá-réir má bhí tú 56 nó ós a cionn ar an 6ú Aibreán 1988 (gur rugadh thú ar nó roimh 6ú Aibreán 1932)
Pro-rata pensions for people with pre-1953 contributions
Pinsean pro-rata do dhaoine a d'íoc ranníocaíochtaí roimh 1953
This pro-rata pension was introduced in May 2000
Tugadh an pinsean seo isteach den chéad uair i mí Bealtaine 2000
You may qualify if you have at least 520 full contributions, some of which must have been paid before 1953
D'fhéadfá a bheith ina theideal má tá 260 ranníocaíochtaí ar a laghad agat ag an lán-ráta agus cuid acu a bheith íoctha roimh 1953
Every 2 contributions paid before 1953 count as 3
Déantar gach 2 ranníocaíochtaí a bhí íoctha roimh 1953 a áireamh mar 3 ranníocaíochtaí
If you meet these conditions, you may get a pro-rata pension of half the normal maximum rate
Má chomhlíonann tú na riachtanais sin d'fhéadfá pinsean dá-réir ag leath ráta a fháil
The increases for a qualified adult and child are also at payable at half-rate
Íoctar an liúntas le haghaidh páiste cleithiúnaigh ag leath an ráta freisin
The increase for pensioners over 80 years of age is paid in full
Íoctar an liúntas le haghaidh duine os cionn 80 ag an ráta iomlán
Pro-rata pension for intermittent insurance
Pinsin pro-rata d'árachas uaineach
This pension no longer applies to new applicants from January 2013
Ní bhaineann an pinsean seo le hiarratasóirí nua ó Eanáir 2013
The first group for whom pro-rata pensions were arranged were those who had been in and out of insurance because of the operation of the income limit on contributions
Socraíodh pinsin pro-rata ar dtús dóibh siúd a raibh árachas acu tráth amháin agus tada acu uair eile de thoradh na dteorainneacha ioncaim a cuireadh ar ranníocaíochtaí
Prior to 1974, non-manual workers were obliged to pay social insurance contributions only if their income was below a certain level
Roimh 1974 ní raibh sé de dhualgas ar oibrithe nach raibh obair láimhe ar siúl acu ranníocaíochtaí árachas sóisialta a dhéanamh ach amháin má bhí a n-ioncam faoi bhun leibhéal áirithe
From 1 April 1974, there has been no income limit
Cuireadh deireadh leis an teorainn ioncaim seo in Aibreán 1974

Many people paid social insurance for a period and then ceased to pay when their income went above the limit then came back into the insurance system in April 1974 because of the abolition of the income limit
D'íoc a lán daoine as árachas sóisialta ar feadh tamaill, d'éirigh as ansin ó thaobh ioncaim os cionn teorainn agus d'fhill ar an gcóras in Aibreán 1974 toisc gur cuireadh an teorainn ioncaim ar ceal
They would not meet the usual average requirement because they ceased to pay for a while
Ní raibh siad ábalta an meánriachtanas a shásamh mar d'éirigh siad as íoc ar feadh tamaill
On 14 October 1988, arrangements were made for them to qualify for a pro-rata pension
Rinneadh socruithe an 14 Meán Fómhair 1988 chun go mbeadh siad incháilithe pinsin pro-rata a fháil
Their average is measured in the usual way and if that average is 10 or more they get a pension in the normal way
Déantar an mheánuimhir a mheas ar an ngnáthbhealach agus má tá 10 nó breis acu ar an meán faigheann siad pinsean ar an ngnáthbhealach
However, if it is between 5 and 9 they may get a special partial pension which is one quarter of the maximum pension
B'fhéidir go bhfaighidh siad pinsean pro-rata, (ceathrú den uasphinsean), áfach, má tá sí idir 5 agus 9
This pro-rata pension is payable to people who meet the quite specific conditions outlined
Is féidir an pinsean pro-rata, seo a íoc le daoine a chomhlíonann na coinníollacha speisialta seo a leanas
That is, you must have a broken insurance record and have re-entered insurance in 1974 because of the removal of the income limit
Is féidir an pinsean pro-rata, seo a íoc le daoine a bhfuil bearnaí ina gcuid árachais acu agus a tháinig isteach in árachas arís sa mbliain 1974 nuair a cuireadh deireadh leis an teorann ioncaim

If you re-entered insurance in that year for any other reason (for example, because you had previously been self-employed or out of the country), you do not meet these specific terms and you would not be eligible for this pro-rata pension

Má tháinig tú isteach in árachas arís sa bhliain sin ar aon chúis eile (mar shampla, mar gheall ar go raibh tú féin-fhostaithe roimhe sin nó amuigh as an tír), ní chomhlíonann tú na riachtanais agus ní bheidh tú i dteideal pinsean pro-rata
If you qualify for this pro-rata pension you may also get the appropriate Increase for Qualified Adult for a dependent spouse, civil partner or cohabitant and an Increase for a Qualified Child
Má tá tú incháilithe an pinsean pro-rata seo a fháil féadfaidh tú liúntas cáilithe an duine fásta a fháil agus liúntas iomlán do leanaí cleithiúnacha
This pro-rata pension is for State Pension (Contributory) and Widow’s, Widower’s or Surviving Civil Partner's Contributory Pension only
Ní bhaineann an pinsean pro-rata seo ach amháin le Pinsean Stáit (Ranníocach) agus le Pinsean Baintrí, Baintrí Fir nó Páirtnéara Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Ranníocach)
Because it is easier to qualify for a Widow’s, Widower's or Surviving Civil Partner's Contributory Pension the numbers who need the pro-rata pensions are very small
Tá sé níos éasca cáiliú le haghaidh Pinsin Baintrí, Baintrí Fir nó Páirtnéara Shibhialta Mharthanaigh (Ranníocach) agus dá bhrí sin tá méid an-bheag de dhaoine atá pinsin pro-rata ag teastáil uathu
